Description: Body sherd of Clazomenian black-figure pottery neck-amphora: exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of swan confronting siren (only traces of swan's head, neck, breast and right wing outstretched, to right; siren's face and neck in added white and breast in added red, to left); the chests of the creatures overlap each other.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Ure Museum of Greek Archaeology, Reading. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Reading I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain, Fasc. 12, University of Reading (p. 39, pl. 23, no. 32)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.016) (Phase 1)
